com.mcc.ul
Class DaqDevice

java.lang.Object
  com.mcc.ul.DaqDevice
Direct Known Subclasses:
EDio24
public abstract class DaqDevice
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a DAQ device.

Method Detail

connect

public abstract void connect()
                      throws ULException
Establishes a connection to a physical DAQ device.

Calling this method while a connection is established will disconnect the device and then reconnect again.

Throws:
ULException

connect

public abstract void connect(int connectionCode,
                             int timeout)
                      throws ULException
Establishes a connection to a physical DAQ device. This method is intended for Ethernet DAQ devices whose default connection code has changed.

Calling this method while a connection is established will disconnect the device and then reconnect again.

Parameters:
connectionCode - The DAQ device connection code
timeout - The timeout value in milliseconds.
Throws:
ULException

hasConnectionPermission

public abstract boolean hasConnectionPermission()
Returns true if a DAQ device has connection permission.

Returns:
Connection permission status.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
For Bluetooth devices, returns the device descriptor associated with the device. For USB devices, returns the product name of the device descriptor.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

getAiDev

public AiDevice getAiDev()
Returns AiDevice if the DAQ device has an analog input subsystem.
Call hasAiDev first to see if the DAQ device has an analog input subsystem.

Returns:
The analog input subsystem of a DAQ device.
Returns null if the DAQ device does not have an analog input subsystem.

getAoDev

public AoDevice getAoDev()
Returns AoDevice if the DAQ device has an analog output subsystem.
Call hasAoDev first to see if the DAQ device has an analog output subsystem.

Returns:
The analog output subsystem of a DAQ device.
Returns null if the DAQ device does not have an analog output subsystem.

getDioDev

public DioDevice getDioDev()
Returns DioDevice if the DAQ device has a digital I/O subsystem.
Call hasDioDev first to see if the DAQ device has a digital I/O subsystem.

Returns:
The digital I/O subsystem of a DAQ device.
Returns null if the DAQ device does not have a digital I/O subsystem.

getCioDev

public CioDevice getCioDev()
Returns CioDevice if the DAQ device has a counter subsystem.
Call hasCioDev first to see if the DAQ device has a counter subsystem.

Returns:
The counter subsystem of a DAQ device.
Returns null if the DAQ device does not have a counter subsystem.

getTmrDev

public TmrDevice getTmrDev()
Returns TmrDevice if the DAQ device has a timer subsystem.
Call hasTmrDev first to see if the DAQ device has a timer subsystem.

Returns:
The timer subsystem of a DAQ device.
Returns null if the DAQ device does not have a timer subsystem.

requestConnectionPermission

public void requestConnectionPermission(DaqDeviceConnectionPermissionListener daqDevicePermissionListener)
                                 throws ULException
Requests permission to connect and access the device.

Note: For USB devices, requesting permission may result in a system dialog being displayed to the user if permission has not previously been granted. If successful, this grants the caller permission to access the device only until the device is physically disconnected.

Parameters:
daqDevicePermissionListener - Permission to connect request.
Throws:
ULException

flashLed

public void flashLed(int flashCount)
              throws ULException
Causes the LED on a DAQ device to flash.

Parameters:
flashCount - The number of flashes. For some devices this parameter is ignored.
Throws:
ULException

enableEvent

public void enableEvent(java.util.EnumSet<DaqEventType> eventType,
                        java.lang.Object eventParameter,
                        DaqEventListener eventListener)
                 throws ULException
Binds one or more event conditions to a DaqEventListener object.

Upon detection of an event condition, the callback method onDaqEvent will be invoked.

Parameters:
eventType - Event conditions.
eventParameter - Additional data required to specify an event condition.
eventListener - Callback function to handle event types.
Throws:
ULException

disableEvent

                  throws ULException
Disables one or more event conditions, and disconnects their user-defined handlers.

Parameters:
eventType - Event conditions.
Throws:
ULException
